newsitem.title: USA: US chain store sales up 0.8 pct -- BTM/Schroders.
newsitem.headline: US chain store sales up 0.8 pct -- BTM/Schroders.

text.p: U.S. chain store sales rose 0.8 percent in the week ended October 19 from the prior week, according to the seasonally adjusted BTM/Schroders weekly chain store sales index.
Sales for the week were up 3.8 percent on a year-over-year basis, while the month-to-date index fell 0.2 percent from the prior month.

Department stores' strength was "most apparent in continued strong sales of better-priced apparel, although several retailers mentioned a mondest category-wide pickup in apparel," a Schroder Wertheim & Co report said.
